reference.shortdesc: A note contains information that expands on or calls attention to a particular point.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: Variant types of note (tip, caution, danger, restriction, etc.) can be indicated through values selected on the type attribute.

section.title: Formatting expectations
section.draft-comment: Should we say that the note element typically results in some prefixed word like "Note" or "Caution"? That seems to be the intent of the current "may be formatted as xyz" in our example.
section.p: A note is typically formatted in a way that stands out from the surrounding content.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample demonstrates the use of a note with type set to "tip".
example.codeblock: <note type="tip">Thinking of a seashore, green meadow, or cool mountain overlook can help you to relax and be more patient.</note>
example.draft-comment: Robert does not really like explicitly addressing formatting in the example, as below, with "It could be formatted as xyz", because ... sure, it could, but it could be formatted lots of other ways too?
example.p: The sample markup could produce output such as the following:
Tip: Thinking of a seashore, green meadow, or cool mountain overlook can help you to relax and be more patient.
